data.title: California Cannabis Track-and-Trace/METRC System Workshops for Licensees
data.author: Department of Cannabis Control
data.excerpt: We invite you to join us at one of our upcoming California Cannabis Track-and-Trace (CCTT-METRC) System workshops for an advanced overview of the CCTT-METRC system being used statewide to record inventory and movement of cannabis and cannabis products throughout the commercial cannabis supply chain–from cultivation to sale.

content.rendered:
We invite you to join us at one of our upcoming California Cannabis Track-and-Trace (CCTT-METRC) System workshops for an advanced overview of the CCTT-METRC system being used statewide to record inventory and movement of cannabis and cannabis products throughout the commercial cannabis supply chain–from cultivation to sale. All commercial cannabis licensees operating under a state-issued annual or provisional license are required to use the CCTT system. 

The CCTT system integrator, METRC, LLC., will provide an advanced system overview targeted to current CCTT users. The presenters will review the questions most often asked about the system, and they will provide demonstrations to help cannabis licensees avoid common mistakes. Representatives from the California Department of Food and Agriculture’s CalCannabis Cultivation Licensing Division and the California Department of Public Health’s Manufactured Cannabis Safety Branch also will provide a brief presentation. A question-and-answer session will be held at the end of each workshop. Please see the following confirmed dates and locations:

1) Tuesday, October 1, 2019
2pm – 5pm
Ukiah Valley Conference Center
200 S School Street, Ukiah, CA 95482

Reservations are not required, and the workshops are free. We hope you’ll join us!

CalCannabis Cultivation Licensing is a division of the California Department of Food and Agriculture. For more information on the state’s commercial cannabis cultivation licensing process, please visit CalCannabis.cdfa.ca.gov, call toll-free 1-833-CALGROW, or send an email to calcannabis@cdfa.ca.gov.
